solution_line_template: William used two days to the limit, which means {max_hours_per_day} * {days_max_time} = <<{max_hours_per_day}*{days_max_time}={hours_max_days}>>{hours_max_days} hours of horse riding.
For two days he rode a horse {short_ride_hours} a day, which makes up to {short_ride_hours} * {days_short_ride} = <<{short_ride_hours}*{days_short_ride}={hours_short_days}>>{hours_short_days} hours.

For the next two days, he used only half of the maximum time which means {max_hours_per_day} * {half_time_factor} = <<{max_hours_per_day}*{half_time_factor}={hours_half_day}>>{hours_half_day} hours a day.
That means {days_half_time} * {hours_half_day} = <<{days_half_time}*{hours_half_day}={hours_half_days}>>{hours_half_days} hours during these two days.
So in total William rode his horse for {hours_max_days} + {hours_short_days} + {hours_half_days} = <<{hours_max_days}+{hours_short_days}+{hours_half_days}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours.
